div.p: Our thematic Signature School Programs engage students in learning and provide learning environments that are fun, safe and motivating during the preschool through 8th grade school years.

ul.li: educating the future leaders of Phoenix
in the heart of hip Phoenix

div.p: Every member of our Phoenix #1 family from our top leadership team to our bus drivers and nutrition team to our nurses and teachers and technology gurus and more, is shaping the lives of our students every day. It’s not just our work; it is our passion!

img.alt: Photo of a teacher
Photo of students on a field trip at a light rail station

div.h5: A Great Way to Support the Students of Our District

div.p: The AZ Tax Credit Program allows you the opportunity to receive a dollar-for-dollar tax credit for contributing to public schools. Our students need and deserve your support. Thanks for considering Phoenix #1!

ul.li: Heating, ventilation and air conditioning upgrades

div.p: We have been very focused on updating our infrastructure and buildings and creating classrooms for students that are high-tech, wireless internet enabled and support the integration of a curriculum focused on science, technology, engineering, arts and math.

img.alt: Photo of a Phoenix #1 School Bus

div.p: At Phoenix Elementary School District #1, we are Inspiring Every Child to Achieve! Our 14 schools offer a preschool through 8th grade education in the heart of Phoenix.

h3.a: ABC 15 News Story: Feeding Students During School Closures

div.p: So many families are out of work and struggling to make ends meet. Students who rely on public school lunches should not go hungry. We are here for our Phoenix #1 School District family. See the ABC 15 News Story here: Keeping Students Fed During...

At Phoenix Elementary School District #1, we are working hard to ensure our families are safe and have the resources needed during school closures due to Coronavirus. We are also doing our best to move forward with the next stage in our instructional review process...

h3.a: We are Teaching & Learning from Home!

div.p: Although we are not on our campuses for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to COVID19, we are effectively teaching and learning via online learning! To keep learning all year-long enroll with us by calling 602-523-5757! April 14th, 2020 Here is a...

March 15, 2020 Hello Phoenix #1 Community, Thank you for everyone’s patience, understanding, support, as we navigate this road together. On Friday, we made the difficult decision to close our schools for at least one week effective Monday, March 16, and today, we are writing...

h3.a: Honoring Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. – Schools Closed 1/21

div.p: In honor of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., all 14 schools in Phoenix Elementary School District #1 will be closed on January 21, 2019. Schools will resume classes on January 22, 2019.

h3.a: We Stand Together as One Community Opposed to the Repeal of DACA

div.p: Letter from Arizona Public School District Superintendents In response to the Potential Elimination of DACA (Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals) Arizona is home to approximately 200 school districts – all very unique. We vary in size, grade levels served, and demographics. We vary in...

div.script:

The Ralph Waldo Emerson Site Council is comprised of administrators, teachers, parents, school support staff, a student and local community member.\u00a0 The purpose of the council is to help to advance the school vision, mission and core values by recommending positive changes to school practices,...

div.p: At Phoenix Elementary School District #1, we are Inspiring Every Child to Achieve! Our 14 schools are in the heart of Phoenix. We are right in your neighborhood and accessible by Phoenix Light Rail. We are free. We are public education! We deliver strong academics while integrating the arts, physical education, athletics and club sports. We provide all the support services for our students including free breakfast and lunch, a top-rated before and after school program for children of working parents, as well as nurses, social workers and psychologists to insure all needs are met. For more information, call 602-523-5757.

div.h3: Ensure your child’s needs are met. Enroll today!

div.p:
Phoenix Elementary School District #1
1817 North Seventh Street
Phoenix, Arizona 85006
